p: Coronaviruses belong to the Coronavirinae subfamily of the Coronaviridae family of the order Nidovirales, and this subfamily consists of four genera: Alphacoronavirus, Betacoronavirus, Gammacoronavirus, and Deltacoronavirus (Chen et al. 2020). Coronaviruses of zoonotic origin can, however, evolve into a strain capable of infecting mortally ill people (Su et al. 2016).
